title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 §§ 398-12.1 - Equivalent benefits
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 §§ 398-12.1 - Equivalent benefits

State Regulations
(a) Benefits issued for basic needs
exclusively from State and/or local funds and provided to or on behalf of an
applicant for SSP benefits or SSPNA during the period which the SSI application
is pending, or to a recipient or former recipient of SSP benefits or SSPNA for
any period in which the SSP benefits or SSPNA is reinstated after a period of
suspension or termination which has not otherwise been recovered under the IAR
process in Part 353 of this Title, are considered equivalent benefits when such
benefits are issued for the same period of time for which the recipient of SSP
benefits or SSPNA is also eligible for SSP benefits or SSPNA. (b) Equivalent benefits are subject to
recovery from retroactive SSP benefits or retroactive SSPNA. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18
§§
398-12.1

New

York State Register January 13, 2021/Volume XLIII, Issue 02, eff. 1/13/2021

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
